channel.title: hidden service and ssh reverse connection problem
channel.description:
hello,
i have doubts about the hidden service and the ssh usage...
could i use a ssh reverse connection if i want to forward the connection of my vps to the workstation vm?
should i have to run a hidden service on the workstation in this case?
can i do it without any socks/http proxy?
thanks

item.title: hidden service and ssh reverse connection problem
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
In clearnet context:
Reverse SSH works behind a NAT router / firewall. That’s one point for using reverse SSH.

In Whonix context:
Therefore reverse SSH should work too.

tux07:

should i have to run a hidden service on the workstation in this case?

No need. Only in case you want a (non-reverse) SSH server. In that case, see:

Whonix – 26 Dec 20

Remote Administration - Whonix

Remote Administration

tux07:

can i do it without any socks/http proxy?

Yes.

Read full topic
item.source: hidden service and ssh reverse connection problem
